helpgrid.innerhtml: A loop is a set of instruments that are grouped and calibrated together.You can identify the location as part of a calibration loop.
Enter the location numbers for the new hierarchy created from the item assembly structure in the table window, or click Autonumber All to generate location numbers for each row.
To change the primary system, enter a value in the Primary System field. To create a new system, click New Row.
To associate a new system with the current location, click New Row.
Use this action if you have reset the meter or replaced it with a different physical meter.
To change the parent of this location for a given system, type a value in the New Parent field in the appropriate rows. To apply your changes and return, click OK.
Select an inspection form to add to the Conduct an Inspection Work Center. The inspection form is not associated with a work order.
Select an inspection form to add to the Conduct an Inspection Work Center. The inspection form is not associated with a work order.
Select an inspection form to associate with the selected record. The selected form appears as a recommended inspection form when planning or conducting an inspection.

Indicate the period for which locations are unavailable for maintenance. All locations of the selected type will have the same operational schedule. Overrides for individual locations can be entered in the Manage Location Operational Schedule window.

Indicate the period during which maintenance can be done on locations. All locations of the selected type will have the same maintenance schedule. Overrides for individual locations can be entered in the Manage Location Maintenance Schedule window.

Indicate the period for which a location is unavailable for maintenance. You can add, change, or delete operational periods. The changes that you make here apply to individual locations and override the periods defined in the Define Location Operational Schedule window.

Indicate the period during which maintenance can be done on a location. You can add, change, or delete maintenance periods. The changes that you make here apply to individual locations and override the periods defined in the Define Location Maintenance Schedule window.
Create a new system using the model location as the parent and all selected items as members

<ul> <li> <b> Replace <b/> Replace all members of the system with the current selection <li> <b> Append <b/> Add the current selection as a children of the selected node. Items in the selection that are already members of the system are ignored <li> <b> Delete <b/> Remove all members from the system, and deletes the system <ul/>
